servinfo.title: Front Suspension Frame, Stabilizer Bar and/or Bushings Removal and Installation

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Front Suspension Frame, Stabilizer Bar and/or Bushings Components

s1.ptxt: Hoist vehicle and remove wheels (right & left).
Drain front differential oil (if equipped).
Take out P/S fluid in reservoir with syringe or such.
Remove engine under cover.
Remove suspension control arm referring to Suspension Control Arm Removal and Installation .
Remove right side and left side front drive shaft assembly (if equipped) referring to Front Drive Shaft Assembly Removal and Installation:Front .
Remove stabilizer joints (1). When loosening joint nut, hold stud with hexagon wrench.
Disconnect front fender lining clip (1) (auto leveling headlight model).
Disconnect front height sensor connector (1) (auto leveling headlight model) and then detach clip (2).
Disconnect steering lower shaft from pinion shaft.
Detach P/S oil line from suspension frame and P/S gear case assembly referring to the figure in P/S Hose / Pipe Components .
Remove engine splash cover (2) from front suspension frame (1) (if equipped).
Remove front propeller shaft (if equipped) referring to Propeller Shaft Removal and Installation .
Fix radiator (2) to body with rope (1) to avoid the radiator (2) fall off when front suspension frame lowered.
Support engine assemble by using chain hoist or engine crane.
Support suspension frame at the specified positions (1) indicated in figure.

attention1.ptxt: When removing suspension frame, be sure to apply some supporting equipment under it at well-balanced position as shown in the figure section so as to prevent from its drop.

s1.ptxt: Remove engine front body side mounting nuts (1).
Remove suspension frame mounting bolts (2), and then lower suspension frame (3) with stabilizer bar, P/S gear box assembly and front differential assembly (if equipped).
Remove P/S gear case assembly (1) and front differential assembly (2) (if equipped).
Remove stabilizer bar (1) and bushing (2) from suspension frame (3).
When installing stabilizer, loosely assemble all components while insuring that stabilizer is centered, side-to-side.
Install stabilizer bar (1), stabilizer bushing (2) and stabilizer mounting bracket (3) to suspension frame.

item.ptxt: For correct installation of stabilizer bar, side-to-side, be sure that stopper ring (5) on stabilizer bar aligns with stabilizer bushing, both right and left, as shown in figure.
Install stabilizer bushing so that a cut (6) becomes forward.

s1.ptxt: Tighten stabilizer bar mounting bracket bolts (4) to specified torque.
Install P/S gear case assembly (1) and front differential assembly (2) (if equipped).
Install suspension frame.

attention1.ptxt: When installing suspension frame, be sure to apply some supporting equipment under it at well-balanced position as shown in the figure section so as to prevent from its drop.

attention2.ptxt: Lug (2) in suspension frame (1) must be mated to the corresponding hole in body. And also engine front body side mounting bolts (3) must be mated to the corresponding holes (4) in suspension frame.

s1.ptxt: Tighten suspension frame mounting bolts (1) and engine front body side mounting nuts (2) to specified torque.

attention2.ptxt: If suspension frame mounting bolt is reused, apply engine oil to thread, bearing and trunk surface.

torqueitem.t-part: Engine front body side mounting nut

s1.ptxt: Install engine splash cover (2) from front suspension frame (1) (if equipped).
Remove chain hoist or engine crane from engine and the rope (1) from the radiator (2).
Install engine hood referring to Hood Removal and Installation , if removed.
Install front propeller shaft (if equipped) referring to Propeller Shaft Removal and Installation .
Install P/S oil line referring to P/S Hose / Pipe Components .
Connect steering lower shaft to pinion shaft.
Connect front fender lining clip (1) (auto leveling headlight model).
Connect front height sensor connector (1) (headlight auto leveling model) and then attach clip (2).
Install stabilizer joints (1), and tighten nuts to specified torque. When tightening, hold stud with hexagon wrench.
Install right side and left side front drive shaft assembly (if equipped) referring to Front Drive Shaft Assembly Removal and Installation:Front .
Install suspension control arm referring to Suspension Control Arm Removal and Installation .
Install engine under cover.
Install front wheels and tighten wheel nuts to specified torque.
After installation, be sure to fill specified power steering fluid and bleed air referring to P/S System Air Bleeding Procedure .
Adjust auto leveling headlight system (if equipped), refer to Initialization of Headlight Auto Leveling System .
Check front wheel alignment adjust it as necessary.
